Flu.description: Persistent headache with dizziness and breathlessness are common in uncontrolled high blood pressure.
Flu.action: Check blood pressure immediately. Seek urgent care if shortness of breath worsens.

Pneumonia.description: Joint pain and stiffness lasting more than 6 weeks is characteristic of rheumatoid arthritis.
Pneumonia.action: Consult a rheumatologist for early diagnosis and treatment.

Common Cold.description: Joint pain and stiffness lasting more than 6 weeks is characteristic of rheumatoid arthritis.
Common Cold.action: Consult a rheumatologist for early diagnosis and treatment.

COVID-19.description: Severe headache with light sensitivity and nausea suggests migraine.
COVID-19.action: Rest in a dark room, avoid triggers, and consult a doctor if frequent.

Migraine.description: Chronic fever with night sweats and weight loss may indicate tuberculosis.
Migraine.action: Seek immediate medical evaluation for TB screening.

Tonsillitis.description: Sore throat with fever and cough often indicates tonsillar infection.
Tonsillitis.action: Use warm salt water gargle and consult a doctor if symptoms worsen.

Heart Condition.description: Acute nausea and vomiting with abdominal pain indicates food-borne illness.
Heart Condition.action: Hydrate well. Seek medical care if unable to keep fluids down.
